result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus C Haynes

records.addlTxt: for NGI exam
for NGI exam

10:01 AM Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense has discussed an NGI plea.  Defendant is asking for a speedy trial.  Defendant will not enter an NGI plea.  Defense asks the court to perform a colloquy with the defendant regarding an NGI plea.  Defense informs the court what was discussed with the defendant.   Court addresses the defendant.  Defendant now agrees that he should have an NGI evaluation.  BTC: Plea changed to NGI.  Evaluation ordered.
Review hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Review hearing on December 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense asks for another status.  Defendant says he never got a copy of the complaint. Defendant is given a copy of the criminal complaint.  Defendant does not want atty Samuels.  Defendant needs additional security in court.  Defendant continues to argue with and talk over the court.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence
NG plea entered.

9:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State calls Investigator Deaner DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on Cross.
Parties rest.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on charges
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Atty Samuels appears on 22CM81 and 22CF571.  Atty Avery Goodrich appears on 19CF897, 19CM1183 and 19CF250.  There is a report on file that opines the defendant is competent at this time to proceed.  Defense has not gone over the evaluation in depth with the deft. but the defendant has told atty Samuels that he would not be contesting the findings.  Atty Goodrich relies on atty Samuels representation.  Court performs colloquy with the defendant.  The defendant is not contesting the findings.  State asks the court to adopt the findings.  BTC: Defendant is competent to proceed and adopts the findings of the report.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Inpatient.
Competency Examination.

11:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Angove for Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Doctor attempted to interview defendant in RCJ which did not occur due to issues as cooperation and participation.  Doctor has opined that it would be better to be examined at State Mental Health Facility.
Defense has discussed this with defendant, defendant agrees to be sent to facility for evaluation.
BTC: Defendant to be evaluated at State Mental Health Facility for evaluation.
Review hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Review hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:37 AM Defendant Marcus C Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Erin Preston for  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Marcus C Haynes. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Deft. in custody and appears via ipad.  Deft. is not on camera, there is report on file finds that the defendant needs to be evaluated in patient.  Atty Preston is unsure if atty Samuels has discussed the findings.  Atty Samuels is not back until 6-14.  This court is gone next week.  The court is concerned about the defendant.  The court needs to get these findings made.  BTC: Atty Samuels needs to meet with the defendant and go over the findings.  The court must set this on Judge Repischak's calendar next week.  The court will contact Judge Repischak.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on June 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
for comp eval

11:18 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus C Haynes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels appeared by video for Marcus C Haynes. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. The defendant has refused to appear in intake court for the past week.  The court drafted an order to bring the deft. to court.  Defense requests a comp. eval.  BTC: Competency evaluation ordered. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Competency hearing on June 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
